docs.title: Changelog
docs.text:
2025-09-28 Dirk Eddelbuettel edd@debian.org

* altdoc: Additional small customizations
* docs/: Re-rendered

2025-09-27 Dirk Eddelbuettel edd@debian.org

* ChangeLog: Release 1.2.0

* src/xptr.c: Use explicit Rf_error, compact some expressions

2025-09-26 Dirk Eddelbuettel edd@debian.org

* R/xptr.R: Adjust roxygen2 comment to ensure '.registration = TRUE'
and '.fixes = "C_"' is passed to NAMESPACE; .Call() adjusted
* NAMESPACE: Regenerated
* src/xptr.c (R_init_xptr): Also call R_forceSymbols(dll, TRUE)

* README.md: Edited throughout, added badges, r-universe mention,
expand example to new non-pointer format character address

* DESCRIPTION: Minor polish
* man/xptr.Rd: Regenerated

* tests/simpleTests.R: Add set of simple tests
* tests/simpleTests.Rout.save: Add test reference output

* docs/: Regenerated using `altdoc` and mkdocs
* altdoc/: Added

2025-09-25 Dirk Eddelbuettel edd@debian.org

* DESCRIPTION (Authors@R): New Maintainer
* DESCRIPTION (Version, Date): New minor version and date

* src/xptr.c (xptr_address): New argument to use '%lld' instead of '%p'
* R/xptr.R (xptr_address): Support new argument
* man/xptr_address.Rd: Documentation

* .github/workflows/ci.yaml: Support continuous integration

docs.title: Citation
docs.text:
To cite package ‘xptr’ in publications use:

Lai R, Eddelbuettel D (2025). xptr: Manipulating External Pointers. R package version 1.1.3.1, https://github.com/eddelbuettel/xptr/.

docs.title: Changes in version 1.2.0 (2025-09-27)
docs.text:
• New maintainer
  • Compiled functions are now registered, .Call() adjusted
  • README.md and DESCRIPTION edited and update
  • Simple unit tests and continunous integration have been added
  • The package documentation site has been recreated using altdoc

docs.title: Check if the external pointer is null.
Description
docs.text: Check if the external pointer is null.

docs.title: Check if an object is an external pointer.
Description
docs.text: Check if an object is an external pointer.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
new_xptr(address = "", tag = NULL, protected = NULL)

null_xptr(tag = NULL, protected = NULL)

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: address a string of pointer address tag an optional tag protected an objected to be protected from gc within the lifetime of the external pointer

docs.title: Register a finalizer for external pointer.
Arguments
docs.text: s an externalptr object f an R function onexit should the finalizer execute on exit?

docs.title: Set the address of the external pointer.
Description
docs.text: Set the address of the external pointer.

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: s an externalptr object p a string of pointer address

docs.title: Set a protected R object to the external pointer.
Description
docs.text: Set a protected R object to the external pointer.

docs.title: Set a tag to the external pointer.
Description
docs.text: Set a tag to the external pointer.

docs.title: Description
docs.text: There is limited native support for external pointers in the R interface. This package provides some basic tools to verify, create and modify ‘externalptr’ objects.

docs.title: Examples
docs.text:
library("xptr")

library(xptr)
a <- new_xptr("0x11a888090")
b <- new_xptr("0x11a888098")
is_xptr(a)

[1] TRUE

xptr_address(a)

[1] "0x11a888090"

xptr_clear(a)
is_null_xptr(a)

[1] TRUE

set_xptr_address(a, xptr_address(b))
xptr_address(a)

[1] "0x11a888098"

xptr_address(a, FALSE)

[1] "4740120728"

docs.title: Arguments
docs.text: s an externalptr object pf a logical selecting ‘pointer’ format (default) or ‘character’ output

docs.title: Clear the pointer address of the external pointer.
Description
docs.text: Clear the pointer address of the external pointer.

docs.title: Protected R object of the external pointer.
Description
docs.text: Protected R object of the external pointer.
